paragraphs.text: Paris: Why Obama's presence Sunday would have been height of hypocrisy.
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: Commentators from both sides of the political aisle have discussed the "optics" of President Obama's absence from the massive, anti-terrorism march in Paris on January 11
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Sadly, they've all missed the point
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It would have represented a glaring hypocrisy for Mr  Obama, or any highly- ranked official from his administration, to attend the rally
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: A sad fact about our pundit class, conservative or progressive, is that they too often miss the obvious
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: That condition infects both critics and supporters of the Obama administration
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: They simply cannot connect the dots with this leader
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: After all
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: he is an unusual president
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: So let me draw a line between the unconnected dots
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Just two years ago, the administration blamed the killing of the American ambassador to Libya, and three security personnel, on a video that negatively depicted the prophet Muhammad
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Remember that?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: You see
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: it was an unknown, bigoted Christian man from California who single- handedly caused the death of our ambassador
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: According to the administration, the film by Nakoula Basseley Nakoulahad sparked spontaneous riots to defend Muhammad's honor
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: our ambassador got caught up in the mayhem
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Mr  Obama called the filmmaker a "shadowy character," and in front of the United Nations and the world, blamed the attack on the "disgusting" movie
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: At that podium, he declared that "the future must not belong to those who slander the prophet of Islam."
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: Congressional hearings later proved that the violence in Benghazi was due to a coordinated terrorist attack
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and had nothing to do with a protest over the movie
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But administration officials stuck to the lie
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Just a few weeks after the attack, the filmmaker was arrested on parole charges by federal authorities
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: probably taking orders from Attorney General Holder
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Now fast-forward to the rally in Paris-- the one that Holder would not deem worthy to attend, even though he was in Paris at the time
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: The one that President Obama, nor Vice President Biden, nor Secretary of State Kerry would attend either
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: even though other major world leaders rushed to Paris to demonstrate their solidarity
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Let me draw the line between the dots a little darker
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Q
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Who did the terrorists attack in Paris on January 7?
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: A: A satirist magazine that had mocked Christians for years
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Q: Why
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: did the terrorists kill those specific journalists and cartoonists?
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: A
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: For a mocking portrayal of Muhammad
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Q
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Isn't
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: that the same issue that had enraged the White House after the Benghazi attack?
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: A
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: You betcha
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The "bad optics" that so many pundits are complaining about actually fit perfectly into the philosophical mindset of this White House
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: They do not want us to insult their Islamist friends
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In the eyes of the Obama administration, the jihadists in Libya and France committed the same savagery for the same reason
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Give the administration credit for consistency
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: They're not about to appear sympathetic to a French cartoonist when they had condemned the filmmaker from California
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Having persecuted the latter
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: they weren't about to march to defend the former
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: What represents bad optics to most civilized people's worldview represents good optics to the Obama administration's worldview
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It's all too clear that America and the world have no hope of stopping these never-ending barbaric acts
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: until
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: a Reagan-like figure steps up
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: A leader who will honestly and courageously define such terrorism
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: as
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: it really is
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: An Islamist's interpretation of the Koran
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: That's the definition recently used by President el-Sisi of Egypt, a man of far greater honesty and courage than America's current counterpart
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Only with an American leader of Reagan-like strength will we be able to develop a plan and the determination to defeat the dark ideology of Islamism
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: just like Reagan managed to defeat the Soviet Union and its evil ideology
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Dr  Michael Youssef is the founding pastor of the Church of the Apostles in Atlanta, Georgia and the author of over 30 books, including his most recent, "Jesus, Jihad & Peace: What Does Bible Prophecy Say About World Events Today?"
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: (Feb  17, 2015, Worthy Publishers)
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Find him online at www.michaelyoussef.com and follow him on Twitter: @MichaelAYoussef
paragraphs.label: no-unit
